articles.title: Hurricane Erin prompts evacuation orders along N.C. Outer Banks - Axios
articles.description: The U.S. was expected to avoid a direct hit, but Dare County made the order due to the storm's expected "life-threatening impacts."

articles.title: After Putin’s win in Alaska, Zelensky travels to Washington for his day of high stakes talks, how far can he push Trump? - CNN
articles.description: At what was billed as an “historic” presidential summit, hastily put together in Alaska on Friday afternoon, the optics were as clear and overshadowing as the vast Chugach mountains glistening over Anchorage in the summer sun.

articles.title: What to know as GOP governors plan to send National Guard units to D.C. - The Washington Post
articles.description: National Guard troops in D.C. may soon be armed. Separately, GOP governors say they’ll send their own troops to the city.

articles.title: 'Potentially life-threatening' flooding risk in Twin Cities, southern Minnesota - Bring Me The News
articles.description: Heavy rain could exacerbate conditions in already saturated areas.

articles.title: Soho House close to $1.8bn take-private deal - Financial Times
articles.description: London members’ club that went global set to be bought out by investors led by New York-based MCR Hotels

articles.title: Iraq starts excavating large mass grave left by Islamic State - NBC News
articles.description: Iraqi officials have begun the excavation of what is believed to be a mass grave left behind by the Islamic State extremist group during its rampage across the country a decade ago.

articles.title: Scottie Scheffler rallies from 4 shots down and wins BMW Championship for 5th victory of the year - AP News
articles.description: Scottie Scheffler's latest victory came with flair. He rallied from a four-shot deficit in the BMW Championship against Robert MacIntyre. Clinging to a one-shot lead, Scheffler chipped in from 82 feet on the 17th hole for a birdie that all but sealed his fift…

articles.title: Barbara Palvin Reveals She Had Life-Changing Surgery for Endometriosis and Shares Candid Photos from Hospital - AOL.com
articles.description: Barbara Palvin, the model and wife of Dylan Sprouse, revealed that she underwent surgery for endometriosis. Palvin shared her health update, as well as photos from the hospital, on Instagram on Aug. 17.

articles.title: Bond Market’s Rate-Cut Bets Enter Decisive Stretch With Powell - Bloomberg.com
articles.description: Bond traders’ big bet that the Federal Reserve is poised to lower interest rates faces a key moment this week as Chair Jerome Powell gets a chance to weigh in on the economy.

articles.title: Terence Stamp, British actor who portrayed General Zod in early Superman films, dies at 87 - AP News
articles.description: Terence Stamp, the British actor who often played the role of a complex villain, including that of General Zod in the early Superman films, has died. He was 87. His death on Sunday was disclosed in a death notice published online. The London-born Stamp starte…

articles.title: Jim Harbaugh had three-word response to NCAA’s sign-stealing sanctions - MLive.com
articles.description: "Like I said to you last year, I'm not engaging," Harbaugh told reporters in Los Angeles on Saturday.

articles.title: Singer Jade Thirwall Calls Resisting Ozempic A 'Daily Battle' - tmz.com
articles.description: Jade Thirwall says she feels the appeal toward Ozempic ... and, her past eating disorder makes it a fight not to use the drug.

articles.title: Aaron Pico releases first statement after UFC debut knockout loss - MMA Fighting
articles.description: Aaron Pico reflects on his ill-fated UFC debut.

articles.title: Officials warn of retaliation risk after Brooklyn hookah bar mass shooting - Gothamist
articles.description: Mayor Eric Adams and the NYPD say crisis teams are on the ground to prevent potential retaliatory violence.

articles.title: U.S. tourist attacked by a shark while spearfishing in the Bahamas - CBS News
articles.description: The shark attack happened near Big Grand Cay on the island of Abaco, Bahamas, on Sunday, police said.

articles.title: Cloudbursts are causing chaos in parts of India and Pakistan. Here’s what they are - AP News
articles.description: Cloudbursts are causing chaos in mountainous parts of India and Pakistan, with tremendous amounts of rain falling in a short period of time over a concentrated area. The intense, sudden deluges have proved fatal in both countries. A cloudburst occurs when a l…
